profile.name: Bernhard Riemann
profile.biography: Georg Friedrich Bernhard Riemann (1826-1866) was a German mathematician who made profound contributions to analysis, number theory, and differential geometry. His work laid the foundation for much of modern mathematics and physics, including Einstein's theory of general relativity.
profile.legacy: Riemann's ideas continue to influence mathematics and physics today, with the Riemann Hypothesis remaining one of the most important unsolved problems in mathematics.

milestones.event: Entered University of Göttingen to study theology, later switched to mathematics under Gauss
Presented doctoral thesis on the theory of functions of a complex variable
Delivered famous habilitation lecture 'On the Hypotheses which Lie at the Foundations of Geometry', introducing Riemannian geometry
Became professor at Göttingen; published paper on prime numbers introducing the Riemann zeta function and Riemann Hypothesis

contributions.title: Riemann Hypothesis
contributions.description: The conjecture about the distribution of prime numbers, regarding the zeros of the Riemann zeta function. It remains one of the most important unsolved problems in mathematics and is one of the Clay Mathematics Institute's Millennium Prize Problems.
contributions.impact: Fundamental to number theory and has connections to cryptography, quantum mechanics, and random matrix theory.

contributions.title: Riemannian Geometry
contributions.description: A generalization of non-Euclidean geometry that studies curved spaces using the concept of a metric tensor. This framework became essential for Einstein's theory of general relativity.
contributions.impact: Provided the mathematical foundation for describing curved spacetime in physics and modern differential geometry.

contributions.title: Complex Analysis and Riemann Surfaces
contributions.description: Revolutionary work on functions of complex variables and the concept of Riemann surfaces as multi-sheeted coverings of the complex plane.
contributions.impact: Fundamental to modern complex analysis, algebraic geometry, and string theory in physics.

contributions.title: Riemann Integral
contributions.description: A rigorous definition of the definite integral using the concept of upper and lower sums, providing a foundation for integration theory.
contributions.impact: Became the standard definition of integration in mathematics education for over a century.
